Namely, Chittorgarh, Kumbalgarh Fort, Ranthambore Fort, Amer Fort, Gagron Fort, Jaisalmer Fort; these a (Read More)re clustered together as the UNESCO World Heritage Site. Here is the list of 31 Majestic Forts of Rajasthan That Will Take You Back In Time 1. Chittorgarh Fort, Chittorgarh 4.2 /5 View 33+ photos Sprawling across a hill, Chittorgarh Fort symbolizes the valor and grandeur of Rajput rulers. The fort, witness to several historic sieges and battles, houses significant monuments like Rana Kumbha Palace and Padmini's Palace. Its towers and battlements resound tales of sacrifice and heroism.Open Timings: 9:30 AM to 5:00 PMEntry Fee: INR 40 for Indians; INR 100 for foreigners Read More 2. Amer Fort, Jaipur View 20+ photos Perched atop a hill in Jaipur, Amber Fort is a blend of Rajput and Mughal architecture. It's known for its opulent palace, beautiful courtyards, and stunning views of the Maota Lake below. The Sheesh Mahal (Mirror Palace) inside is a notable attraction, reflecting a mesmerizing play of light.Open Timings: 8:00 AM to 5:30 PMEntry Fee: INR 100 for Indians; INR 500 for foreigners Read More 3. Kumbhalgarh Fort, Kumbhalgarh 4.6 /5 View 17+ photos With walls extending over 36 kilometers, Kumbhalgarh Fort claims to have the second-longest wall after the Great Wall of China. This UNESCO World Heritage Site sits atop a hill, offering breathtaking views of the Aravalli Range. Inside, the fort houses hundreds of temples, palaces, and step wells, depicting the finesse of Rajput architecture.Open Timings: 9:00 AM to 6:00 PMEntry Fee: INR 15 for Indians; INR 200 for foreigners Read More 4. Ranthambhore Fort, Ranthambore 4.5 /5 Nestled within the confines of the Ranthambore National Park, the Ranthambore Fort is a UNESCO World Heritage Site. The fort, often overshadowed by the park's tiger safaris, boasts splendid architecture, ancient temples, and panoramic views of the surrounding jungle. The fort and the park together offer a blend of historical and natural experiences.Open Timings: 6:00 AM to 6:00 PMEntry Fee: INR 15 for Indians; INR 200 for foreigners Read More Rajasthan Travel Packages Compare quotes from upto 3 travel agents for free 5 Nights / 6 Days Pearls of Rajasthan Tour Packages for 5N Jaipur(2N) → Jodhpur(1N) → Udaipur(2N) ₹ 25,900 18% off ₹20,999/person Get Offers> 9 Nights / 10 Days Rajasthan Tour Package 09 Nights 10 Days Jaipur(2N) → Bikaner(1N) → Jaisalmer(2N) → Jodhpur(1N) → ... ₹ 37,500 4% off ₹35,800/person Get Offers> 7 Nights / 8 Days Grand Rajasthan Tour Package for 7 Nights 8 Days Jaipur(2N) → Jodhpur(1N) → Jaisalmer(2N) → Mount Abu(1N) &rarr... ₹ 28,300 6% off ₹26,500/person Get Offers> 5 Nights / 6 Days Best Rajasthan Tour Packages - Jaisalmer, Udaipur & Jodhpur Udaipur(2N) → Jodhpur(1N) → Jaisalmer(2N) ₹21,000/person Get Offers> 4 Nights / 5 Days Jodhpur & Jaisalmer Package - 4N/5D Jaipur(2N) → Jodhpur(2N) Sold By: Travel Corp India(4.8 ) ₹ 32,000 17% off ₹26,450/person Get Offers> 5 Nights / 6 Days Jaipur Jodhpur and Jaisalmer Tour Package Jaipur(2N) → Jodhpur(1N) → Jaisalmer(1N) ₹ 26,900 4% off ₹25,600/person Get Offers> View All Packages For Rajasthan View All Packages For Rajasthan 5. Jaisalmer Fort, Jaisalmer 4.4 /5 View 21+ photos Rising majestically from the Thar Desert, Jaisalmer Fort gleams golden with its massive yellow sandstone walls. It's one of the few living forts in the world, with a bustling community inside its walls, full of shops, havelis, and temples. The fort's narrow lanes and intricate architecture tell tales of a bygone era.Open Timings: 9:00 AM to 5:00 PMEntry Fee: INR 50 for Indians; INR 250 for foreigners Read More 6. Mehrangarh Fort, Jodhpur 4.3 /5 View 14+ photos Mehrangarh, also known as Mehran Fort, is one of the largest forts in the country. It is situated at the top of a 410 feet elevated hill and guarded by massive walls. One of the most easily recognisable forts in Jodhpur, it has appeared in many Hollywood and Bollywood productions such as The Lion King, The Dark Knight Rises, and the more recent - Thugs of Hindostan. Open Timings: 9:00 AM - 5:00 PM Entry Fee: Indians (Includes the Audio): INR 600, Foreigners: INR 700 Read More 7. Nahargarh Fort, Jaipur 4.3 /5 View 17+ photos Overlooking the Pink City of Jaipur, Nahargarh Fort stands on the edge of the Aravalli Hills. Originally built as a defense fort, it boasts intricate architecture and provides stunning views, especially at sunset. The fort has been part of many Bollywood films, enhancing its charm and popularity among tourists.Open Timings: 10:00 AM to 5:30 PMEntry Fee: INR 50 for Indians; INR 200 for foreigners Read More 8. Taragarh Fort, Bundi 4.2 /5 View 5+ photos Perched atop a steep hill, Taragarh Fort offers panoramic views of the city of Bundi. Often referred to as the ‘Star Fort’, its sprawling battlements, tunnels, and grand gateways are reminiscent of Rajput glory. Inside, the fort houses reservoirs, step wells, and the Rani Mahal, all bearing tales from a bygone era.Open Timings: 8:00 AM to 7:00 PMEntry Fee: INR 75 for Indians; INR 500 for foreigners Read More 9. Gagron Fort, Jhalawar A unique hill and water fort, Gagron Fort is surrounded by rivers on three sides and a deep moat on the fourth, offering natural protection. Recognized as a UNESCO World Heritage Site, the fort stands as a silent spectator of countless battles and showcases the Rajput and Mughal architectural influences. Its serene ambiance, with the rivers' gentle flow, makes it a picturesque location.Open Timings: 8:00 AM to 6:00 PMEntry Fee: INR 10 for Indians; INR 100 for foreigners Read More 10. Junagarh Fort, Bikaner 4.3 /5 View 5+ photos In the heart of Bikaner lies the Junagarh Fort, an epitome of Rajput architecture with influences of Mughal, Gujarati, and British styles. Inside the fort are captivating palaces, courtyards, and a museum showcasing Rajasthan's regal history. The fort's intricate balconies, towers, and windows exemplify the craftsmanship of ancient artisans.Open Timings: 10:00 AM to 4:30 PMEntry Fee: INR 50 for Indians; INR 300 for foreigners Read More 11. Bhangarh Fort, Alwar 4.2 /5 View 5+ photos Often dubbed as the 'most haunted fort' in India, Bhangarh Fort offers an eerie yet intriguing experience. Though in ruins, its temples, palaces, and havelis are enveloped in tales of paranormal activities. While visitors flock to experience the mystery, the fort's architecture and setting amidst the Aravallis also draw admiration.Open Timings: 6:00 AM to 6:00 PMEntry Fee: INR 25 for Indians; INR 200 for foreigners Read More 12. Neemrana Fort Palace, Neemrana 4.1 /5 View 5+ photos Dating back to the 15th century, Neemrana Fort is one of India's oldest heritage resorts, gracefully restoring the regal aura of its past. Perched on a hill, its tiered construction offers majestic views of the surrounding landscape. Today, while it serves as a luxury hotel, its grandeur, step wells, and hanging gardens can be experienced by day visitors too.Open Timings: 9:00 AM to 3:00 PM (for day visitors)Entry Fee: Approximately INR 1,500 to INR 2,500 (includes lunch) Read More 13. Jaigarh Fort, Jaipur 4.4 /5 View 16+ photos Dominating the skyline near Amber, Jaigarh Fort stands as a testament to the military might of medieval Rajasthan. The fort is home to the world's largest cannon on wheels, Jaivana, and features robust battlements, watchtowers, and sprawling courtyards. It offers breathtaking views of the surrounding Aravalli hills and Amber Fort.Open Timings: 9:00 AM to 4:30 PMEntry Fee: INR 70 for Indians; INR 150 for foreigners Read More 14. Lohagarh Fort, Bharatpur 4.4 /5 View 5+ photos The Lohagarh Fort, translating to 'Iron Fort', stands as a testament to its indomitable spirit, having never been captured by invaders. The fort, with its deep moats, sturdy walls, and impressive bastions, symbolizes resilience. Inside, architectural marvels such as Kishori Mahal, Mahal Khas, and Kothi Khas await visitors.Open Timings: 10:00 AM to 6:00 PMEntry Fee: INR 20 for Indians; INR 250 for foreigners Read More 15. Bala Quila Fort, Alwar 3.6 /5 Standing atop a steep hill, Bala Qila or Alwar Fort overlooks the city of Alwar. The fort's ramparts stretch across several kilometers, with six historical gates or 'pols' marking entrances. The fort's architectural marvels, coupled with its history of power struggles, make it a significant landmark in Rajasthan's heritage.Open Timings: 10:00 AM to 5:00 PMEntry Fee: INR 20 for Indians; INR 150 for foreigners Read More 16. Castle Mandawa, Mandawa 4.2 /5 View 6+ photos An architectural marvel in the heart of the Shekhawati region, Castle Mandawa is a blend of old-world charm and modern luxury. Famous for its frescoes, antique interiors, and regal ambiance, this fort turned hotel offers a unique experience. Its archways, turrets, and ornate interiors resonate with tales of Rajputana grandeur.Open Timings: Primarily for hotel guests; day visitors should check ahead.Entry Fee: Variable, depending on activities or meals chosen. Read More 17. Devgarh, Sikar 4.1 /5 View 5+ photos A lesser-known gem, Devgarh Fort in Sikar reflects the grandeur of Shekhawati architecture. While partially in ruins, the fort's impressive gateways, courtyards, and murals tell tales of a bygone era. The serene ambiance, away from touristy crowds, offers a genuine slice of Rajasthan's history.Open Timings: 8:00 AM to 6:00 PMEntry Fee: Free, but donations are welcome. Read More 18. Khejarla Fort, Jodhpur 4.3 /5 Situated 85 km from Jodhpur, the majestic Khejarla Fort stands as a testimony to Rajput valor and architecture. The red sandstone fort, now a heritage hotel, retains its medieval charm with jharokhas, courtyards, and ornate interiors. Amidst rustic surroundings, it offers a blend of history and royal hospitality.Open Timings: Primarily for hotel guests; day visitors might need prior arrangements.Entry Fee: Variable, based on activities or meals availed. Read More 19. Khimsar Fort, Khimsar 3.6 /5 Khimsar Fort offers an incredible journey through Rajasthan's royal legacy. Initially a military fort, it now showcases grand courtyards, battlements, and a luxury heritage hotel experience. Nestled in the desert, the fort offers a picturesque desert village setting, making it a traveler's delight.Open Timings: Primarily for hotel guests; day visitors can inquire ahead.Entry Fee: Depends on activities or meals chosen during the visit. Read More 20. Kesroli, Alwar 3.5 /5 View 8+ photos Believed to be one of the oldest heritage sites, Kesroli stands atop the rare, dark Hornstone Breccia rocks. The fort, now a heritage hotel, captures the essence of its medieval past with turrets, ramparts, and arched verandahs. Offering panoramic views of the surrounding landscapes, it's a blend of history and luxury.Open Timings: Mostly reserved for hotel guests, day visitors should inquire in advance.Entry Fee: Variable, based on activities or meals availed. Read More 21. Deeg Fort, Deeg 3.4 /5 Nestled in the town of Deeg, this fort is an epitome of architectural magnificence. Built primarily as a luxurious summer resort for the rulers, the fort showcases splendid gardens, water palaces, and ornate fountains. The elaborate water engineering, in sync with its Rajput and Mughal architectural designs, makes it a unique attraction.Open Timings: 9:00 AM to 5:00 PMEntry Fee: INR 30 for Indians; INR 200 for foreigners Read More 22. Danta Ramgarh, Sikar 3.4 /5 Located in the heart of Sikar, Danta Ramgarh boasts tales of historic battles and grandeur. The fort's towering ramparts, adorned with Rajput and Mughal architectural elements, overlook the bustling town below. Though time has worn its edifices, the fort still stands as a silent sentinel to the region's illustrious past.Open Timings: 8:00 AM to 6:00 PMEntry Fee: Free, though donations are accepted. Read More 23. Jhalawar Fort, Jhalawar 3.4 /5 Locally known as Garh Palace, Jhalawar Fort lies in the heart of the Jhalawar city. The fort complex features a mix of courtyards, halls, and a notable theater built during the British era. While portions of the fort serve administrative purposes today, its architecture and murals provide glimpses into Rajasthan's rich cultural tapestry.Open Timings: 10:00 AM to 5:00 PMEntry Fee: INR 20 for Indians; INR 150 for foreigners Read More 24. Kishangarh Fort, Ajmer Dominating the Kishangarh skyline, this fort exemplifies Rajasthani fort architecture. Built in the 17th century, Kishangarh Fort stands amidst a moat, with a vast expanse of walls, bastions, and ornate gates. The fort's historical prominence is complemented by its association with Kishangarh miniature paintings, a notable art form.Open Timings: 9:00 AM to 4:30 PMEntry Fee: INR 30 for Indians; INR 200 for foreigners Read More 25. Roopangarh Fort, Ajmer 4.3 /5 Initially built as a fortress in the 16th century, Roopangarh Fort has witnessed numerous battles and sieges. The fort, with its towering walls and sprawling courtyards, showcases Rajput architectural splendor. Today, it's transformed into a heritage hotel, offering visitors a blend of history and luxury.Open Timings: Primarily for hotel guests, but day visitors can inquire ahead.Entry Fee: Variable, depending on activities or meals chosen. Read More 26. Jai Pol, Alwar 3.2 /5 Jai Pol is one of the significant gateways of the Alwar Fort, representing the fort's defensive architecture. The name 'Jai Pol' translates to 'Victory Gate', signifying triumph over adversaries. Its robust construction, adorned with bastions, reflects the fort's strategic significance and the valiant history of the region.Open Timings: 10:00 AM to 5:00 PMEntry Fee: INR 20 for Indians; INR 150 for foreigners (for the entire Alwar Fort) Read More 27. Badalgarh Fort, Shekhawati 3.1 /5 Perched on a rocky hill, Badalgarh Fort in Shekhawati stands as a testament to Rajasthan's rich history. With its rugged battlements and ancient structures, the fort recalls tales of valor and bravery from medieval times. Although in ruins, its strategic position offers panoramic views of the surrounding landscape.Open Timings: 9:00 AM to 5:00 PMEntry Fee: Free, but donations are accepted. Read More 28. Nagaur Fort, Khimsar One of the most significant flatland forts in Rajasthan, Nagaur Fort, also known as Ahhichatragarh, showcases impressive Rajput-Mughal architectural elements. It has witnessed numerous battles and has undergone several renovations. Inside, the fort complex houses palaces, temples, fountains, and gardens, reflecting the grandeur of the medieval era.Open Timings: 10:00 AM to 5:00 PMEntry Fee: INR 20 for Indians; INR 200 for foreigners Read More 29. Achalgarh Fort, Mount-abu 4.1 /5 Achalgarh Fort is a 15-century fort in Mount Abu which now lies in ruins. The ruined fort complex houses a huge gate called Hanumanpol, which served as the main entrance. There. is a famous Shiva Temple (Achaleshwar Mahadev Temple) and Mandakini Lake inside the fort complex. Another major attraction is a huge Nandi statue.Open Timings: 9:00 AM to 5:00 PMEntry Fee: Free Read More 30. Bhatner Fort, Hanumangarh Believed to be over 1700 years old, Bhatner Fort is one of the oldest forts in India, built along the banks of River Ghaggar. Its massive bastions and wide moats make it a formidable structure. The fort, with its intricate carvings and inscriptions, offers a journey through the pages of history, having withstood several invasions.Open Timings: 8:00 AM to 6:00 PMEntry Fee: INR 10 for Indians; INR 100 for foreigners 31. Jalore Fort, Jalore A testament to the architectural prowess of ancient India, Jalore Fort stands tall on a hill known as 'Songir', the fort's strategic position offering protection from invaders. Once considered impregnable, its massive battlements and ornate gates are testimonies to the historic battles and grandeur of the bygone era. Panoramic views of the city below and the serene surroundings make it a favorite among visitors.Open Timings: 8:00 AM to 6:00 PMEntry Fee: Free; However, donations are accepted. So, next time you visit this state, don't miss out these marvellous forts of Rajasthan which are also UNESCO World Heritage Sites!
